heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

storm.status: The last storm was on 04 September 2025 which lasted for 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwave.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwave in progress.  So far, 6 heatwaves have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (181°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 53.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 4.6°C) and outside temperature (down 3.8°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1055 m), feels like temperature (up 7.8°C), outside temperature (up 6.2°C), and dew point temperature (up 3.6°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 701.3m lower than yesterday, 169.1m lower than the past week, 1054.6m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 835m and a high of 3910m, averaging 1484.0m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and winds will be practically absent. Drizzle or light rain possible, occasional overcast conditions, and it’s dark. Weather patterns to stay the same.
